verses.verse: Now Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> was a mighty<WH1368> man of valor,<WH2428> and he was the son<WH1121> of an harlot:<WH2181> and Gilead<WH1568> begat<WH3205> Jephthah.<WH3316>

And Gilead's<WH1568> wife<WH802> bore<WH3205> him sons;<WH1121> and his wife's<WH802> sons<WH1121> grew<WH1431> up, and they thrust<WH1644> out Jephthah,<WH3316> and said<WH559> to him, You shall not inherit<WH5157> in our father's<WH1> house;<WH1004> for you are the son<WH1121> of a strange<WH312> woman.<WH802>

Then Jephthah<WH3316> fled<WH1272> from his brothers,<WH251> and dwelled<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Tob:<WH2897> and there were gathered<WH3950> vain<WH7386> men<WH582> to Jephthah,<WH3316> and went<WH3318> out with him.
And it came<WH1961> to pass in process of time,<WH3117> that the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against<WH5973> Israel.<WH3478>

And it was so, that when<WH834> the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> made war<WH3898> against<WH5973> Israel,<WH3478> the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> went<WH3212> to fetch<WH3947> Jephthah<WH3316> out of the land<WH776> of Tob:<WH2897>
And they said<WH559> to Jephthah,<WH3316> Come,<WH3212> and be our captain,<WH7101> that we may fight<WH3898> with the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> to the elders<WH2205> of Gilead,<WH1568> Did not you hate<WH8130> me, and expel<WH1644> me out of my father's<WH1> house?<WH1004> and why<WH4069> are you come<WH935> to me now<WH6258> when<WH834> you are in distress?<WH6887>

And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> to Jephthah,<WH3316> Therefore we turn<WH7725> again<WH7725> to you now,<WH6258> that you may go<WH1980> with us, and fight<WH3898> against the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and be our head<WH7218> over all<WH3605> the inhabitants<WH3427> of Gilead.<WH1568>

And Jephthah<WH3316> said<WH559> to the elders<WH2205> of Gilead,<WH1568> If<WH518> you bring<WH7725> me home<WH7725> again<WH7725> to fight<WH3898> against the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and the LORD<WH3068> deliver<WH5414> them before<WH6440> me, shall I be your head?<WH7218>

And the elders<WH2205> of Gilead<WH1568> said<WH559> to Jephthah,<WH3316> The LORD<WH3068> be witness<WH8085> between<WH996> us, if<WH518> we do<WH6213> not so<WH3651> according to your words.<WH1697>

Then Jephthah<WH3316> went<WH3212> with the elders<WH2205> of Gilead,<WH1568> and the people<WH5971> made<WH7760> him head<WH7218> and captain<WH7101> over<WH5921> them: and Jephthah<WH3316> uttered<WH1696> all<WH3605> his words<WH1697> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> in Mizpeh.<WH4709>

And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> saying,<WH559> What<WH4100> have you to do with me, that you are come<WH935> against<WH413> me to fight<WH3898> in my land?<WH776>

And the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> answered<WH559> to the messengers<WH4397> of Jephthah,<WH3316> Because<WH3588> Israel<WH3478> took<WH3947> away my land,<WH776> when they came<WH5927> up out of Egypt,<WH4714> from Arnon<WH769> even to Jabbok,<WH2999> and to Jordan:<WH3383> now<WH6258> therefore restore<WH7725> those lands again<WH7725> peaceably.<WH7965>
And Jephthah<WH3316> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> again<WH3254> <WH5750> to the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon:<WH5983>
And said<WH559> to him, Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> Jephthah,<WH3316> Israel<WH3478> took<WH3947> not away the land<WH776> of Moab,<WH4124> nor the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon:<WH5983>
But when Israel<WH3478> came<WH5927> up from Egypt,<WH4714> and walked<WH3212> through the wilderness<WH4057> to the Red<WH5488> sea,<WH3220> and came<WH935> to Kadesh;<WH6946>

Then Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to the king<WH4428> of Edom,<WH123> saying,<WH559> Let me, I pray<WH4994> you, pass<WH5674> through your land:<WH776> but the king<WH4428> of Edom<WH123> would not listen<WH8085> thereto. And in like<WH1571> manner they sent<WH7971> to the king<WH4428> of Moab:<WH4124> but he would<WH14> not consent:<WH14> and Israel<WH3478> stayed<WH3427> in Kadesh.<WH6946>

Then they went<WH3212> along through the wilderness,<WH4057> and compassed<WH5437> the land<WH776> of Edom,<WH123> and the land<WH776> of Moab,<WH4124> and came<WH935> by the east<WH4217> <WH8121> side of the land<WH776> of Moab,<WH4124> and pitched<WH2583> on the other<WH5676> side<WH5676> of Arnon,<WH769> but came<WH935> not within the border<WH1366> of Moab:<WH4124> for Arnon<WH769> was the border<WH1366> of Moab.<WH4124>

And Israel<WH3478> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of the Amorites,<WH567> the king<WH4428> of Heshbon;<WH2809> and Israel<WH3478> said<WH559> to him, Let us pass,<WH5674> we pray<WH4994> you, through your land<WH776> into<WH5704> my place.<WH4725>

But Sihon<WH5511> trusted<WH539> not Israel<WH3478> to pass<WH5674> through his coast:<WH1366> but Sihon<WH5511> gathered<WH622> all<WH3605> his people<WH5971> together, and pitched<WH2583> in Jahaz,<WH3096> and fought<WH3898> against<WH5973> Israel.<WH3478>

And the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> delivered<WH5414> Sihon<WH5511> and all<WH3605> his people<WH5971> into the hand<WH3027> of Israel,<WH3478> and they smote<WH5221> them: so Israel<WH3478> possessed<WH3423> all<WH3605> the land<WH776> of the Amorites,<WH567> the inhabitants<WH3427> of that country.<WH776>
And they possessed<WH3423> all<WH3605> the coasts<WH1366> of the Amorites,<WH567> from Arnon<WH769> even to Jabbok,<WH2999> and from the wilderness<WH4057> even to Jordan.<WH3383>
So now<WH6258> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> has dispossessed<WH3423> the Amorites<WH567> from before<WH6440> his people<WH5971> Israel,<WH3478> and should you possess<WH3423> it?

Will not you possess<WH3423> that which<WH834> Chemosh<WH3645> your god<WH430> gives you to possess?<WH3423> So whomsoever<WH3605> <WH834> the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> shall drive<WH3423> out from before<WH6440> us, them will we possess.<WH3423>

And now<WH6258> are you any thing better<WH2896> than Balak<WH1111> the son<WH1121> of Zippor,<WH6834> king<WH4428> of Moab?<WH4124> did he ever strive<WH7378> against<WH5973> Israel,<WH3478> or did he ever fight<WH3898> against<WH5973> them,

While Israel<WH3478> dwelled<WH3427> in Heshbon<WH2809> and her towns,<WH1323> and in Aroer<WH6177> and her towns,<WH1323> and in all<WH3605> the cities<WH5892> that be along by the coasts<WH3027> of Arnon,<WH769> three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> years?<WH8141> why<WH4069> therefore did you not recover<WH5337> them within that time?<WH6256>

Why I have not sinned<WH2398> against you, but you do<WH6213> me wrong<WH7451> to war<WH3898> against me: the LORD<WH3068> the Judge<WH8199> be judge<WH8199> this day<WH3117> between<WH996> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> and the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>
However, the king<WH4428> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> listened<WH8085> not to the words<WH1697> of Jephthah<WH3316> which<WH834> he sent<WH7971> him.

Then the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> came<WH1961> on Jephthah,<WH3316> and he passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> Gilead,<WH1568> and Manasseh,<WH4519> and passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead,<WH1568> and from Mizpeh<WH4708> of Gilead<WH1568> he passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> to the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>
And Jephthah<WH3316> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> to the LORD,<WH3068> and said,<WH559> If<WH518> you shall without fail deliver<WH5414> the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> into my hands,<WH3027>

Then it shall be, that whatever<WH834> comes<WH3318> forth<WH3318> of the doors<WH1817> of my house<WH1004> to meet<WH7125> me, when I return<WH7725> in peace<WH7965> from the children<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> shall surely be the LORD's,<WH3068> and I will offer<WH5927> it up for a burnt<WH5930> offering.
So Jephthah<WH3316> passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> to the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> to fight<WH3898> against them; and the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> them into his hands.<WH3027>

And he smote<WH5221> them from Aroer,<WH6177> even till<WH5704> you come<WH935> to Minnith,<WH4511> even twenty<WH6242> cities,<WH5892> and to the plain<WH58> of the vineyards,<WH3754> with a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> slaughter.<WH4347> Thus the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> were subdued<WH3665> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Israel.<WH3478>

And Jephthah<WH3316> came<WH935> to Mizpeh<WH4709> to his house,<WH1004> and, behold,<WH2009> his daughter<WH1323> came<WH3318> out to meet<WH7125> him with tambourines<WH8596> and with dances:<WH4246> and she was his only<WH3173> child;<WH3173> beside her he had neither<WH369> son<WH1121> nor<WH176> daughter.<WH1323>

And it came<WH1961> to pass, when he saw<WH7200> her, that he rent<WH7167> his clothes,<WH899> and said,<WH559> Alas,<WH162> my daughter!<WH1323> you have brought<WH3766> me very low,<WH3766> and you are one of them that trouble<WH5916> me: for I have opened<WH6475> my mouth<WH6310> to the LORD,<WH3068> and I cannot<WH3808> <WH3201> go<WH7725> back.<WH7725>

And she said<WH559> to him, My father,<WH1> if you have opened<WH6475> your mouth<WH6310> to the LORD,<WH3068> do<WH6213> to me according to that which<WH834> has proceeded<WH3318> out of your mouth;<WH6310> for as much<WH310> <WH834> as the LORD<WH3068> has taken<WH6213> vengeance<WH5360> for you of your enemies,<WH341> even of the children<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>

And she said<WH559> to her father,<WH1> Let this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> be done<WH6213> for me: let me alone<WH7503> two<WH8147> months,<WH2320> that I may go<WH3212> up and down<WH3381> on the mountains,<WH2022> and mourn<WH1058> my virginity,<WH1331> I and my fellows.<WH7464>

And he said,<WH559> Go.<WH3212> And he sent<WH7971> her away for two<WH8147> months:<WH2320> and she went<WH3212> with her companions,<WH7464> and bewailed<WH1058> her virginity<WH1331> on the mountains.<WH2022>

And it came<WH1961> to pass at the end<WH7093> of two<WH8147> months,<WH2320> that she returned<WH7725> to her father,<WH1> who did<WH6213> with her according to his vow<WH5088> which<WH834> he had vowed:<WH5087> and she knew<WH3045> no<WH3808> man.<WH376> And it was a custom<WH2706> in Israel,<WH3478>
That the daughters<WH1323> of Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> yearly<WH3117> to lament<WH8567> the daughter<WH1323> of Jephthah<WH3316> the Gileadite<WH1569> four<WH702> days<WH3117> in a year.<WH8141>
